reviews.text: I buy my groceries here occasionally though I donâ€™t live near here. The food court is within a throw stone. There are more eateries at the lower floor. Easy to find parking lot. Public transport is easily accessible too.

It seems that most of the time the train will end in this Joo Koon station instead of the Tuas Link station. This is a very remote area in the extreme west part of Singapore. It is nice to know that they have a FairPrice Hub mall that is linked to the train station that offers quite a lot of F&B outlets. Overall, it's a nice mrt station except that there are very few train services that goes to Tuas Link.

Mrt is Just one level below Fairprice warehouse  club and same level as decathlon..

When u go down u find few indian restuarents like Nandhana and small Indian eateries.. And also there is a food court at level 3 outside FP warehouse...

Toast box hans ar also there for quick buyers and coffee...

Level 1 has KFC, Mac d, Thai food...and Indonesian.. You can get all the things here

Malay cleaner aunty forbid me from entering the handicapped cubicle even when there is no nearby physically handicapped person around.

And she assumed that I was not handicapped by the outfit I wore.

Ridiculous. So if a person is trans they are not able to use handicapped toilet as well?
Good place for worker in jurong to shopping or use MRT
